alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 29 at 4:19PM EDT until April 01 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT /1 PM CDT/ WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 2 PM EDT /1 PM CDT/ Wednesday to 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 8 AM EDT /7 AM CDT/ this morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
